meta.content: Front Page; New York and Region
meta.name: online_sections

block.p: Congress Backs Debt Relief Under pressure from churches, charities and rock stars, Congressional leaders have agreed to back President Clinton's plan to ease the debt burden of the world's poorest nations.

Poll Positive for Corzine Most voters either do not know or do not care that Jon S. Corzine is shattering spending records in his race for a United States Senate seat from New Jersey, a New York Times poll has found.
Van Horn Breaks Leg Nets forward Keith Van Horn broke his left leg during an exhibition loss to the Magic in Orlando, Fla. He is expected to miss at least the first two weeks of the regular season.

Debate Over Public Theater Under George C. Wolfe's leadership the Joseph Papp Public Theater has produced hits and misses, but two flops are fueling arguments over whether the theater needs a new vision.

Congress Backs Debt Relief Under pressure from churches, charities and rock stars, Congressional leaders have agreed to back President Clinton's plan to ease the debt burden of the world's poorest nations.

Poll Positive for Corzine Most voters either do not know or do not care that Jon S. Corzine is shattering spending records in his race for a United States Senate seat from New Jersey, a New York Times poll has found.
Van Horn Breaks Leg Nets forward Keith Van Horn broke his left leg during an exhibition loss to the Magic in Orlando, Fla. He is expected to miss at least the first two weeks of the regular season.

Debate Over Public Theater Under George C. Wolfe's leadership the Joseph Papp Public Theater has produced hits and misses, but two flops are fueling arguments over whether the theater needs a new vision.
